user_auth.forms module

class user_auth.forms.CustomUserCreationForm(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: UserCreationForm

A custom user creation form that extends UserCreationForm and adds an email field.

This form is used for user registration and includes fields for username, email, and passwords.

Parameters:

UserCreationForm (Form class) – The base form for user creation provided by Django.

class Meta

Bases: object

fields = ('username', 'email', 'password1', 'password2')

The fields to include in the form.

Parameters:

fields (tuple) – A tuple of field names to include in the form.

model

The User model to use for user creation.

Parameters:

User (Model class) – The User model provided by Django’s authentication system.

alias of User

declared_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}

An email field for the user’s email address.

  • required (bool) – Indicates whether this field is required. True means it’s required.

user_auth.models module

user_auth.tests module

user_auth.urls module

user_auth.views module

user_auth.views.register(request)

Handle user registration.

If the HTTP request method is POST, attempt to register the user using the provided form data. If registration is successful, log in the user and redirect to the albums page.

If the method is not POST, render the registration template with an empty registration form.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The registration template with the registration form or a redirect to the albums page.

user_auth.views.user_login(request)

Handle user login.

If the HTTP request method is POST, attempt to authenticate and log in the user using the provided form data. If login is successful, redirect to the homepage or another desired location.

If the method is not POST, render the login template with the login form.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The login template with the login form or a redirect to the homepage or another desired location.

user_auth.views.user_logout(request)

Handle user logout.

Log out the user and redirect to the homepage or another desired location.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

A redirect to the homepage or another desired location.
